home.title: Neuroinformatics Department
home.subtitle: Center for Neuroscience - CNeuro
home.introduction: The Neuroinformatics Department develops and applies computational methods for the analysis of neuroscientific data. Our work integrates disciplines such as statistics, machine learning, and mathematical modeling in service of neuroscience research.
home.role: As part of CNeuro, the department provides methodological and computational support to the center's research projects, while also developing its own research lines in neural data analysis and neuroimaging.

whoWeAre.title: Who We Are
whoWeAre.description: The Neuroinformatics Department at CNeuro integrates computational and analytical methods for the study of the nervous system. Our work focuses on developing tools and methodologies to understand neural mechanisms through complex data analysis.

context.title: Institutional Context
context.content: The Neuroinformatics Department is a unit within the Center for Neuroscience (CNeuro) specialized in quantitative analysis of neuroscientific data. The department operates at the intersection of neuroscience, computer science, and applied mathematics.

relationship.title: Relationship with CNeuro
relationship.content: As an integral part of CNeuro, the department collaborates with the center's various research groups by providing methodological expertise in experimental design, statistical analysis, and computational modeling. This collaboration facilitates the translation of experimental data into knowledge about the structure and function of the nervous system.

mission.title: Mission
mission.content: To develop and apply rigorous computational methods for the analysis of neuroscientific data, contributing to the advancement of knowledge about the nervous system through the use of quantitative tools and the training of researchers in neuroinformatics.

scope.title: Scope of Work
areas: Analysis of electroencephalography (EEG) and magnetoencephalography (MEG) data
Processing and analysis of functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI)
Development of software tools for neuroscientific data analysis
Application of machine learning methods to neural data
